## Description {#details}

Additional information about basic blocks where the current variable is live.

Such a block will look like one of these templates:


<ul>
<li>| o—x | Internal to block. Variable is only live in this block.</li>
<li>|—x | Live-in, kill.</li>
<li>| o—| Def, live-out.</li>
<li>|—x o—| Live-in, kill, def, live-out. Counted by NumGapBlocks.</li>
<li>|—o—o—| Live-through with uses or defs.</li>
<li>|--------—| Live-through without uses. Counted by NumThroughBlocks.</li>
</ul>


Two <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo">BlockInfo</a> entries are created for template 4. One for the live-in segment, and one for the live-out segment. These entries look as if the block were split in the middle where the live range isn&#39;t live.

Live-through blocks without any uses don&#39;t get <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/splitanalysis/blockinfo">BlockInfo</a> entries. They are simply listed in ThroughBlocks instead.

Definition at line 121 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/splitkit-h">SplitKit.h</a>.
